docs.snippet: SHIKLER--Aaron A., Painter. Born to Frank and Annie Shikler on March 18, 1922, in Brooklyn, NY. Died November 12, 2015, in New York City. Predeceased by his wife of 51 years, Barbara "Pete" Lurie Shikler and sisters: Eve Altman, Jean Rieder, Molli...
docs.lead_paragraph:
SHIKLER--Aaron A., Painter.

Born to Frank and Annie Shikler on March 18, 1922, in Brooklyn, NY. Died November 12, 2015, in New York City. Predeceased by his wife of 51 years, Barbara "Pete" Lurie Shikler and sisters: Eve Altman, Jean Rieder, Mollie Geller, Julia Gerstenhaber and Ethel Shikler; and by best friends and colleagues David Levine and Roy Davis. Aaron graduated from the first class of The High School of Music and Art, now LaGuardia High School, 1940. He received his BFA and MFA in Art and Education from Tyler School of Art, Temple University. A member of the National Academy and The Century Association. Private First Class, Army Air Corps, WWll, cartographer. Survived by his children: Cathy Shikler van Ingen and Clifford Shikler; grandchildren Isabella, Lane, Montgomery, Benjamin and Alexei; son-in-law Armand van Ingen and daughter-in-law Christina Ross Shikler, and by his many nieces, nephews, colleagues, friends and students. Burial private. Memorial Service in January.

headline.main: Prosecutors Planning 3rd Trial of Alabama Police Officer

headline.main: England Must Improve Passing, Decision Making-Hodgson
headline.print_headline: England Must Improve Passing, Decision Making-Hodgson

docs.snippet: England's passing and decision making must improve if they are to mount a serious challenge at Euro 2016, manager Roy Hodgson said after Friday's chastening 2-0 defeat to European champions Spain in a friendly....
docs.lead_paragraph: England's passing and decision making must improve if they are to mount a serious challenge at Euro 2016, manager Roy Hodgson said after Friday's chastening 2-0 defeat to European champions Spain in a friendly.
